channel.title: 317 PI stubborn, annoying error
channel.description:
My client broke randomly the other day without me adding or modifying anything. [SPOILER=Client][IMG]http://puu.sh/8Yf9f.png[/img][/SPOILER]
Eclipse shows this:[SPOILER=Eclipse][IMG]http://puu.sh/8Yfe2.png[/img][/SPOILER] The error occurs just after it says: 602 NPC amount : 11257.
I've tried completely different cache downloaders etc as well as restoring my backup. After 3 hours the backup broke too, again without any modification.
I am only asking here as a last resort, obviously I have tried to fix it and also searched the web.
Any help much appreciated.
EDIT: The source is TrasidiaX V3 and the cache is from V2 of The same server.

item.title: 317 PI stubborn, annoying error
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

Maybe a little late, but usually for me that error comes from cache downloading. Auto cache downloader for example. I know you when to your backup but ive had the same error messing around with my cache downloader and fixed it. gl

Read full topic

item.title: 317 PI stubborn, annoying error
item.dc:creator: @nzxt nzxt
item.description:
@nzxt wrote:

Thanks for the replies, respect to mopar, the only forums to actually reply to my issue so thanks. I ended up just going to my backup, (was only one day old and it’s completely gone) I think my co-owner may have done something whilst I was gone but the date modified on all files is the same, weird.

Thanks though guys.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 PI stubborn, annoying error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:2, topic:543332”]There is an interface(or something) called 868685
and that number is too big.[/quote]
Now expand on that and explain how to solve it.

  1. You can make the ID of the interface lower. Search that ID in RSInterface.java then lower it. Make sure you change all instances of that number because they’re most likely for the same element.

  2. Extend the interface/sprite amount. I’m not exactly sure which one you have too many of, but it’s probably interfaces. I’ll show both just in case.
    Find:

		spriteNodes = new MRUNodes(50000);

Should be right underneath the method start.
Change the 50000 to a value higher than the number that’s giving the error (868685).

Find:

		interfaceCache = new RSInterface[j + 31000];

Change the 31000 (yours may not be 31000, look for the variable interfaceCache) to a higher value like before.

I highly recommend going with solution #1 instead of #2 because #2 can drastically change the loading time (in a bad way).

Read full topic
